019import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
022import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;

024import java.lang.annotation.*;
025import java.nio.charset.*;
026import java.util.*;
027import java.util.function.*;
028import java.util.regex.*;

030import org.apache.juneau.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;

034import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;

038/**
039 * Serializes POJOs to HTTP responses as HTML documents.
040 *
041 * <h5 class='topic'>Media types</h5>
042 * <p>
043 * Handles <c>Accept</c> types:  <bc>text/html</bc>
044 * <p>
045 * Produces <c>Content-Type</c> types:  <bc>text/html</bc>
046 *
047 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
048 * <p>
049 * Same as {@link HtmlSerializer}, except wraps the response in <code><xt>&lt;html&gt;</code>,
050 * <code><xt>&lt;head&gt;</code>, and <code><xt>&lt;body&gt;</code> tags so that it can be rendered in a browser.
051 *
052 * <p>
053 * Configurable properties are typically specified via <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja>.
054 *
055 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
056 * <p class='bjava'>
057 *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
058 *       messages=<js>"nls/AddressBookResource"</js>,
059 *       title=<js>"$L{title}"</js>,
060 *       description=<js>"$L{description}"</js>
061 *    )
062 *    <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja>(
063 *       navlinks={
064 *          <js>"api: servlet:/api"</js>,
065 *          <js>"doc: doc"</js>
066 *       }
067 *    )
068 *    <jk>public class</jk> AddressBookResource <jk>extends</jk> BasicRestServlet {
069 * </p>
070 *
071 * <p>
072 * The <c>$L{...}</c> variable represent localized strings pulled from the resource bundle identified by the
073 * <c>messages</c> annotation.
074 * <br>These variables are replaced at runtime based on the HTTP request locale.
075 * <br>Several built-in runtime variable types are defined, and the API can be extended to include user-defined variables.
076 *
077 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
078 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
079 * </ul>
080 *
081 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
082 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/HtmlBasics">HTML Basics</a>
083
084 * </ul>
085 */
086public class HtmlDocSerializer extends HtmlStrippedDocSerializer {
087
088   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
089   // Static
090   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
091
092   private static final String[] EMPTY_ARRAY = {};
093
094   /** Default serializer, all default settings. */
095   public static final HtmlDocSerializer DEFAULT = new HtmlDocSerializer(create());
096
097   /**
098    * Creates a new builder for this object.
099    *
100    * @return A new builder.
101    */
102   public static Builder create() {
103      return new Builder();
104   }
105
106   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
107   // Builder
108   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
109
110   /**
111    * Builder class.
112    */
113   @FluentSetters
114   public static class Builder extends HtmlStrippedDocSerializer.Builder {
115
116      private static final Cache<HashKey,HtmlDocSerializer> CACHE = Cache.of(HashKey.class, HtmlDocSerializer.class).build();
117
118      List<String> aside, footer, head, header, nav, navlinks, script, style, stylesheet;
119      AsideFloat asideFloat;
120      String noResultsMessage;
121      boolean nowrap, resolveBodyVars;
122      Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> template;
123      List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets;
124
125      /**
126       * Constructor, default settings.
127       */
128      protected Builder() {
129         produces("text/html");
130         accept("text/html");
131         asideFloat = AsideFloat.RIGHT;
132         noResultsMessage = "<p>no results</p>";
133         template = BasicHtmlDocTemplate.class;
134      }
135
136      /**
137       * Copy constructor.
138       *
139       * @param copyFrom The bean to copy from.
140       */
141      protected Builder(HtmlDocSerializer copyFrom) {
142         super(copyFrom);
143         aside = copy(copyFrom.aside);
144         footer = copy(copyFrom.footer);
145         head = copy(copyFrom.head);
146         header = copy(copyFrom.header);
147         nav = copy(copyFrom.nav);
148         navlinks = copy(copyFrom.navlinks);
149         script = copy(copyFrom.script);
150         style = copy(copyFrom.style);
151         stylesheet = copy(copyFrom.stylesheet);
152         asideFloat = copyFrom.asideFloat;
153         noResultsMessage = copyFrom.noResultsMessage;
154         nowrap = copyFrom.nowrap;
155         resolveBodyVars = copyFrom.resolveBodyVars;
156         template = copyFrom.template;
157         widgets = copy(copyFrom.widgets);
158      }
159
160      /**
161       * Copy constructor.
162       *
163       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy from.
164       */
165      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
166         super(copyFrom);
167         aside = copy(copyFrom.aside);
168         footer = copy(copyFrom.footer);
169         head = copy(copyFrom.head);
170         header = copy(copyFrom.header);
171         nav = copy(copyFrom.nav);
172         navlinks = copy(copyFrom.navlinks);
173         script = copy(copyFrom.script);
174         style = copy(copyFrom.style);
175         stylesheet = copy(copyFrom.stylesheet);
176         asideFloat = copyFrom.asideFloat;
177         noResultsMessage = copyFrom.noResultsMessage;
178         nowrap = copyFrom.nowrap;
179         resolveBodyVars = copyFrom.resolveBodyVars;
180         template = copyFrom.template;
181         widgets = copy(copyFrom.widgets);
182      }
183
184      @Override /* Context.Builder */
185      public Builder copy() {
186         return new Builder(this);
187      }
188
189      @Override /* Context.Builder */
190      public HtmlDocSerializer build() {
191         return cache(CACHE).build(HtmlDocSerializer.class);
192      }
193
194      @Override /* Context.Builder */
195      public HashKey hashKey() {
196         return HashKey.of(
197            super.hashKey(),
198            aside,
199            footer,
200            head,
201            header,
202            nav,
203            navlinks,
204            script,
205            style,
206            stylesheet,
207            asideFloat,
208            noResultsMessage,
209            nowrap,
210            resolveBodyVars,
211            template,
212            widgets
213         );
214      }
215
216      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
217      // Properties
218      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
219
220      /**
221       * Aside section contents.
222       *
223       * <p>
224       * Allows you to specify the contents of the aside section on the HTML page.
225       * The aside section floats on the right of the page for providing content supporting the serialized content of
226       * the page.
227       *
228       * <p>
229       * By default, the aside section is empty.
230       *
231       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
232       * <p class='bjava'>
233       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
234       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
235       *       .aside(
236       *          <js>"&lt;ul&gt;"</js>,
237       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 1"</js>,
238       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 2"</js>,
239       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 3"</js>,
240       *          <js>"&lt;/ul&gt;"</js>
241       *       )
242       *       .build();
243       * </p>
244       *
245       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
246       *    <li class='note'>
247       *       Format: HTML
248       *    <li class='note'>
249       *       Supports <a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerSvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
250       *       (e.g. <js>"$L{my.localized.variable}"</js>).
251       *    <li class='note'>
252       *       A value of <js>"NONE"</js> can be used to force no value.
253       *    <li class='note'>
254       *       The parent value can be included by adding the literal <js>"INHERIT"</js> as a value.
255       *    <li class='note'>
256       *       Multiple values are combined with newlines into a single string.
257       *    <li class='note'>
258       *       On methods, this value is inherited from the <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja> annotation on the servlet/resource class.
259       *    <li class='note'>
260       *       On servlet/resource classes, this value is inherited from the <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja> annotation on the
261       *       parent class.
262       * </ul>
263       *
264       * @param value
265       *    The new value for this property.
266       * @return This object.
267       */
268      @FluentSetter
269      public Builder aside(String...value) {
270         aside = merge(aside, value);
271         return this;
272      }
273
274      /**
275       * Returns the list of aside section contents.
276       *
277       * <p>
278       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #aside(String...)}.
279       *
280       * @return The list of aside section contents.
281       * @see #aside(String...)
282       */
283      public List<String> aside() {
284         if (aside == null)
285            aside = list();
286         return aside;
287      }
288
289      /**
290       * Float aside section contents.
291       *
292       * <p>
293       * Allows you to position the aside contents of the page around the main contents.
294       *
295       * <p>
296       * By default, the aside section is floated to the right.
297       *
298       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
299       * <p class='bjava'>
300       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
301       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
302       *       .aside(
303       *          <js>"&lt;ul&gt;"</js>,
304       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 1"</js>,
305       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 2"</js>,
306       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 3"</js>,
307       *          <js>"&lt;/ul&gt;"</js>
308       *       )
309       *       .asideFloat(<jsf>RIGHT</jsf>)
310       *       .build();
311       * </p>
312       *
313       * @param value
314       *    The new value for this property.
315       * @return This object.
316       */
317      @FluentSetter
318      public Builder asideFloat(AsideFloat value) {
319         asideFloat = value;
320         return this;
321      }
322
323      /**
324       * Footer section contents.
325       *
326       * <p>
327       * Allows you to specify the contents of the footer section on the HTML page.
328       *
329       * <p>
330       * By default, the footer section is empty.
331       *
332       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
333       * <p class='bjava'>
334       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
335       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
336       *       .footer(
337       *          <js>"&lt;b&gt;This interface is great!&lt;/b&gt;"</js>
338       *       )
339       *       .build();
340       * </p>
341       *
342       * @param value
343       *    The new value for this property.
344       * @return This object.
345       */
346      @FluentSetter
347      public Builder footer(String...value) {
348         footer = merge(footer, value);
349         return this;
350      }
351
352      /**
353       * Returns the list of footer section contents.
354       *
355       * <p>
356       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #footer(String...)}.
357       *
358       * @return The list of footer section contents.
359       * @see #footer(String...)
360       */
361      public List<String> footer() {
362         if (footer == null)
363            footer = list();
364         return footer;
365      }
366
367      /**
368       * Additional head section content.
369       *
370       * <p>
371       * Adds the specified HTML content to the head section of the page.
372       *
373       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
374       * <p class='bjava'>
375       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
376       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
377       *       .head(
378       *          <js>"&lt;link rel='icon' href='$U{servlet:/htdocs/mypageicon.ico}'&gt;"</js>
379       *       )
380       *       .build();
381       * </p>
382       *
383       * @param value
384       *    The new value for this property.
385       * @return This object.
386       */
387      @FluentSetter
388      public Builder head(String...value) {
389         head = merge(head, value);
390         return this;
391      }
392
393      /**
394       * Returns the list of head section contents.
395       *
396       * <p>
397       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #head(String...)}.
398       *
399       * @return The list of head section contents.
400       * @see #head(String...)
401       */
402      public List<String> head() {
403         if (head == null)
404            head = list();
405         return head;
406      }

408      /**
409       * Header section contents.
410       *
411       * <p>
412       * Allows you to override the contents of the header section on the HTML page.
413       * The header section normally contains the title and description at the top of the page.
414       *
415       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
416       * <p class='bjava'>
417       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
418       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
419       *       .header(
420       *          <js>"&lt;h1&gt;My own header&lt;/h1&gt;"</js>
421       *       )
422       *       .build()
423       * </p>
424       *
425       * @param value
426       *    The new value for this property.
427       * @return This object.
428       */
429      @FluentSetter
430      public Builder header(String...value) {
431         header = merge(header, value);
432         return this;
433      }
434
435      /**
436       * Returns the list of header section contents.
437       *
438       * <p>
439       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #header(String...)}.
440       *
441       * @return The list of header section contents.
442       * @see #header(String...)
443       */
444      public List<String> header() {
445         if (header == null)
446            header = list();
447         return header;
448      }
449
450      /**
451       * Nav section contents.
452       *
453       * <p>
454       * Allows you to override the contents of the nav section on the HTML page.
455       * The nav section normally contains the page links at the top of the page.
456       *
457       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
458       * <p class='bjava'>
459       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
460       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
461       *       .nav(
462       *          <js>"&lt;p class='special-navigation'&gt;This is my special navigation content&lt;/p&gt;"</js>
463       *       )
464       *       .build()
465       * </p>
466       *
467       * <p>
468       * When this property is specified, the {@link Builder#navlinks(String...)} property is ignored.
469       *
470       * @param value
471       *    The new value for this property.
472       * @return This object.
473       */
474      @FluentSetter
475      public Builder nav(String...value) {
476         nav = merge(nav, value);
477         return this;
478      }
479
480      /**
481       * Returns the list of nav section contents.
482       *
483       * <p>
484       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #nav(String...)}.
485       *
486       * @return The list of nav section contents.
487       * @see #nav(String...)
488       */
489      public List<String> nav() {
490         if (nav == null)
491            nav = list();
492         return nav;
493      }
494
495      /**
496       * Page navigation links.
497       *
498       * <p>
499       * Adds a list of hyperlinks immediately under the title and description but above the content of the page.
500       *
501       * <p>
502       * This can be used to provide convenient hyperlinks when viewing the REST interface from a browser.
503       *
504       * <p>
505       * The value is an array of strings with two possible values:
506       * <ul>
507       *    <li>A key-value pair representing a hyperlink label and href:
508       *       <br><js>"google: http://google.com"</js>
509       *    <li>Arbitrary HTML.
510       * </ul>
511       *
512       * <p>
513       * Relative URLs are considered relative to the servlet path.
514       * For example, if the servlet path is <js>"http://localhost/myContext/myServlet"</js>, and the
515       * URL is <js>"foo"</js>, the link becomes <js>"http://localhost/myContext/myServlet/foo"</js>.
516       * Absolute (<js>"/myOtherContext/foo"</js>) and fully-qualified (<js>"http://localhost2/foo"</js>) URLs
517       * can also be used in addition to various other protocols specified by {@link UriResolver} such as
518       * <js>"servlet:/..."</js>.
519       *
520       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
521       * <p class='bjava'>
522       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
523       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
524       *       .navlinks(
525       *          <js>"api: servlet:/api"</js>,
526       *          <js>"stats: servlet:/stats"</js>,
527       *          <js>"doc: doc"</js>
528       *       )
529       *       .build();
530       * </p>
531       *
532       * @param value
533       *    The new value for this property.
534       * @return This object.
535       */
536      @FluentSetter
537      public Builder navlinks(String...value) {
538         navlinks = mergeNavLinks(navlinks, value);
539         return this;
540      }
541
542      /**
543       * Returns the list of navlinks section contents.
544       *
545       * <p>
546       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #navlinks(String...)}.
547       *
548       * @return The list of navlinks section contents.
549       * @see #navlinks(String...)
550       */
551      public List<String> navlinks() {
552         if (navlinks == null)
553            navlinks = list();
554         return navlinks;
555      }
556
557      /**
558       * No-results message.
559       *
560       * <p>
561       * Allows you to specify the string message used when trying to serialize an empty array or empty list.
562       *
563       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
564       * <p class='bjava'>
565       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
566       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
567       *       .noResultsMessage(<js>"&lt;b&gt;This interface is great!&lt;/b&gt;"</js>)
568       *       .build();
569       * </p>
570       *
571       * <p>
572       * A value of <js>"NONE"</js> can be used to represent no value to differentiate it from an empty string.
573       *
574       * @param value
575       *    The new value for this property.
576       * @return This object.
577       */
578      @FluentSetter
579      public Builder noResultsMessage(String value) {
580         noResultsMessage = value;
581         return this;
582      }
583
584      /**
585       * Prevent word wrap on page.
586       *
587       * <p>
588       * Adds <js>"* {white-space:nowrap}"</js> to the CSS instructions on the page to prevent word wrapping.
589       *
590       * @return This object.
591       */
592      @FluentSetter
593      public Builder nowrap() {
594         return nowrap(true);
595      }
596
597      /**
598       * Same as {@link #nowrap()} but allows you to explicitly specify the boolean value.
599       *
600       * @param value
601       *    The new value for this property.
602       * @return This object.
603       * @see #nowrap()
604       */
605      @FluentSetter
606      public Builder nowrap(boolean value) {
607         nowrap = value;
608         return this;
609      }
610
611      /**
612       * Resolve $ variables in serialized POJO.
613       *
614       * @return This object.
615       */
616      @FluentSetter
617      public Builder resolveBodyVars() {
618         return resolveBodyVars(true);
619      }
620
621      /**
622       * Same as {@link #resolveBodyVars()} but allows you to explicitly specify the boolean value.
623       *
624       * @param value
625       *    The new value for this property.
626       * @return This object.
627       * @see #nowrap()
628       */
629      @FluentSetter
630      public Builder resolveBodyVars(boolean value) {
631         resolveBodyVars = value;
632         return this;
633      }

635      /**
636       * Adds the specified Javascript code to the HTML page.
637       *
638       * <p>
639       * A shortcut on <ja>@Rest</ja> is also provided for this setting:
640       * <p class='bjava'>
641       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
642       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
643       *       .script(<js>"alert('hello!');"</js>)
644       *       .build();
645       * </p>
646       *
647       * @param value
648       *    The value to add to this property.
649       * @return This object.
650       */
651      @FluentSetter
652      public Builder script(String...value) {
653         script = merge(script, value);
654         return this;
655      }
656
657      /**
658       * Returns the list of page script contents.
659       *
660       * <p>

663       * @return The list of page script contents.
664       * @see #script(String...)
665       */
666      public List<String> script() {
667         if (script == null)
668            script = list();
669         return script;
670      }

677       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
678       *       .style(
679       *          <js>"h3 { color: red; }"</js>,
680       *          <js>"h5 { font-weight: bold; }"</js>
681       *       )
682       *       .build();
683       * </p>
684       *
685       * @param value
686       *    The value to add to this property.
687       * @return This object.
688       */
689      @FluentSetter
690      public Builder style(String...value) {
691         style = merge(style, value);
692         return this;
693      }

704      public List<String> style() {

710      /**

719       */
720      @FluentSetter

723         return this;

726      /**
727       * Returns the list of stylesheet URLs.
728       *
729       * <p>

731       *
732       * @return The list of stylesheet URLs.
733       * @see #stylesheet(String...)
734       */
735      public List<String> stylesheet() {
736         if (stylesheet == null)
737            stylesheet = list();
738         return stylesheet;
739      }
740
741      /**
742       * HTML document template.
743       *
744       * <p>
745       * Specifies the template to use for serializing the page.
746       *
747       * <p>
748       * By default, the {@link BasicHtmlDocTemplate} class is used to construct the contents of the HTML page, but
749       * can be overridden with your own custom implementation class.
750       *
751       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
752       * <p class='bjava'>
753       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
754       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
755       *       .template(MySpecialDocTemplate.<jk>class</jk>)
756       *       .build();
757       * </p>
758       *
759       * @param value
760       *    The new value for this property.
761       * @return This object.
762       */
763      @FluentSetter
764      public Builder template(Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> value) {
765         template = value;
766         return this;
767      }
768
769      /**
770       * HTML Widgets.
771       *
772       * <p>
773       * Defines widgets that can be used in conjunction with string variables of the form <js>"$W{name}"</js>to quickly
774       * generate arbitrary replacement text.
775       *
776       * Widgets resolve the following variables:
777       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
778       *    <li><js>"$W{name}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getHtml(VarResolverSession)}.
779       *    <li><js>"$W{name.script}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getScript(VarResolverSession)}.
780       *       <br>The script contents are automatically inserted into the <xt>&lt;head/script&gt;</xt> section
781       *           in the HTML page.
782       *    <li><js>"$W{name.style}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getStyle(VarResolverSession)}.
783       *       <br>The styles contents are automatically inserted into the <xt>&lt;head/style&gt;</xt> section
784       *           in the HTML page.
785       * </ul>
786       *
787       * <p>
788       * The following examples shows how to associate a widget with a REST method and then have it rendered in the links
789       * and aside section of the page:
790       *
791       * <p class='bjava'>
792       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
793       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
794       *       .widgets(
795       *          MyWidget.<jk>class</jk>
796       *       )
797       *       .navlinks(
798       *          <js>"$W{MyWidget}"</js>
799       *       )
800       *       .aside(
801       *          <js>"Check out this widget:  $W{MyWidget}"</js>
802       *       )
803       *       .build();
804       * </p>
805       *
806       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
807       *    <li class='note'>
808       *       Widgets are inherited from super classes, but can be overridden by reusing the widget name.
809       * </ul>
810       *
811       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
812       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/HtmlWidgets">Widgets</a>
813       * </ul>
814       *
815       * @param values The values to add to this setting.
816       * @return This object.
817       */
818      @FluentSetter
819      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
820      public Builder widgets(Class<? extends HtmlWidget>...values) {
821         addAll(widgets(), values);
822         return this;
823      }
824
825      /**
826       * Returns the list of page widgets.
827       *
828       * <p>
829       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #widgets(Class...)}.
830       *
831       * @return The list of page widgets.
832       * @see #widgets(Class...)
833       */
834      public List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets() {
835         if (widgets == null)
836            widgets = list();
837         return widgets;
838      }
839

1612      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1613      // Helpers
1614      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1615
1616      private static <T> List<T> copy(List<T> s) {
1617         return s == null || s.isEmpty() ? null : copyOf(s);
1618      }
1619
1620      private static <T> List<T> copy(T[] s) {
1621         return s.length == 0 ? null : list(s);
1622      }
1623
1624      private List<String> merge(List<String> old, String[] newValues) {
1625         List<String> x = Utils.listOfSize(newValues.length);
1626         for (String s : newValues) {
1627            if ("NONE".equals(s)) {
1628               if (old != null)
1629                  old.clear();
1630            } else if ("INHERIT".equals(s)) {
1631               if (old != null)
1632                  x.addAll(old);
1633            } else {
1634               x.add(s);
1635            }
1636         }
1637         return x;
1638      }
1639
1640      private List<String> mergeNavLinks(List<String> old, String[] newValues) {
1641         List<String> x = Utils.listOfSize(newValues.length);
1642         for (String s : newValues) {
1643            if ("NONE".equals(s)) {
1644               if (old != null)
1645                  old.clear();
1646            } else if ("INHERIT".equals(s)) {
1647               if (old != null)
1648                  x.addAll(old);
1649            } else if (s.indexOf('[') != -1 && INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN.matcher(s).matches()) {
1650               Matcher lm = INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN.matcher(s);
1651               lm.matches();
1652               String key = lm.group(1);
1653               int index = Math.min(x.size(), Integer.parseInt(lm.group(2)));
1654               String remainder = lm.group(3);
1655               x.add(index, key.isEmpty() ? remainder : key + ":" + remainder);
1656            } else {
1657               x.add(s);
1658            }
1659         }
1660         return x;
1661      }
1662
1663      private static final Pattern INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("(?s)(\\S*)\\[(\\d+)\\]\\:(.*)");
1664   }
1665
1666   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1667   // Instance
1668   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1669
1670   final String[] style, stylesheet, script, navlinks, head, header, nav, aside, footer;
1671   final AsideFloat asideFloat;
1672   final String noResultsMessage;
1673   final boolean nowrap, resolveBodyVars;
1674   final Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> template;
1675   final List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets;
1676
1677   private final HtmlWidgetMap widgetMap;
1678   private final HtmlWidget[] widgetArray;
1679   private final HtmlDocTemplate templateBean;
1680
1681   private volatile HtmlSchemaDocSerializer schemaSerializer;
1682
1683   /**
1684    * Constructor.
1685    *
1686    * @param builder The builder for this object.
1687    */
1688   public HtmlDocSerializer(Builder builder) {
1689      super(builder);
1690      style = builder.style != null ? toArray(builder.style) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1691      stylesheet = builder.stylesheet != null ? toArray(builder.stylesheet) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1692      script = builder.script != null ? toArray(builder.script) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1693      head = builder.head != null ? toArray(builder.head) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1694      header = builder.header != null ? toArray(builder.header) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1695      nav = builder.nav != null ? toArray(builder.nav) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1696      aside = builder.aside != null ? toArray(builder.aside) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1697      footer = builder.footer != null ? toArray(builder.footer) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1698      navlinks = builder.navlinks != null ? toArray(builder.navlinks) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1699      asideFloat = builder.asideFloat;
1700      noResultsMessage = builder.noResultsMessage;
1701      nowrap = builder.nowrap;
1702      resolveBodyVars = builder.resolveBodyVars;
1703      template = builder.template;
1704      widgets = builder.widgets == null ? Collections.emptyList() : copyOf(builder.widgets);
1705
1706      templateBean = newInstance(template);
1707      widgetMap = new HtmlWidgetMap();
1708      widgets.stream().map(this::newInstance).forEach(x -> widgetMap.append(x));
1709      widgetArray = Utils.array(widgetMap.values(), HtmlWidget.class);
1710   }
1711
1712   @Override /* Context */
1713   public Builder copy() {
1714      return new Builder(this);
1715   }
1716
1717   @Override /* Context */
1718   public HtmlDocSerializerSession.Builder createSession() {
1719      return HtmlDocSerializerSession.create(this);
1720   }
1721
1722   @Override /* Context */
1723   public HtmlDocSerializerSession getSession() {
1724      return createSession().build();
1725   }
1726
1727   @Override /* XmlSerializer */
1728   public HtmlSerializer getSchemaSerializer() {
1729      if (schemaSerializer == null)
1730         schemaSerializer = HtmlSchemaDocSerializer.create().beanContext(getBeanContext()).build();
1731      return schemaSerializer;
1732   }

1832    */

1881   /**
1882    * HTML widgets.
1883    *
1884    * @see Builder#widgets(Class...)
1885    * @return
1886    *    Widgets defined on this serializers.
1887    */
1888   protected final HtmlWidgetMap getWidgets() {
1889      return widgetMap;
1890   }
1891
1892   /**
1893    * Performs an action on all widgets defined on this serializer.
1894    *
1895    * @param action The action to perform.
1896    * @return This object.
1897    */
1898   protected final HtmlDocSerializer forEachWidget(Consumer<HtmlWidget> action) {
1899      for (HtmlWidget w : widgetArray)
1900         action.accept(w);
1901      return this;
1902   }

1907
1908   private String[] toArray(List<String> x) {
1909      return x.toArray(new String[x.size()]);
1910   }
1911
1912   private <T> T newInstance(Class<T> c) {
1913      try {
1914         return c.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
1915      } catch (Exception e) {
1916         throw asRuntimeException(e);
1917      }
1918   }
1919
1920   @Override /* Context */
1921   protected JsonMap properties() {
1922      return filteredMap()
1923         .append("header", header)
1924         .append("nav", nav)
1925         .append("navlinks", navlinks)
1926         .append("aside", aside)
1927         .append("asideFloat", asideFloat)
1928         .append("footer", footer)
1929         .append("style", style)
1930         .append("head", head)
1931         .append("stylesheet", stylesheet)
1932         .append("nowrap", nowrap)
1933         .append("template", template)
1934         .append("noResultsMessage", noResultsMessage)
1935         .append("widgets", widgets);
1936   }
